intro: Christella abrupta, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It typically forms dense mats of slender, succulent stems covered in tiny, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. Its succulent nature allows it to store water, making it well-adapted to drought conditions. Christella abrupta plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
